citeinfo.origin: US Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 2, Realty Division, Cadastral Surveying and Mapping
citeinfo.title: Sevilleta National Wildlife Refuge Land Ownership Status

descript.abstract: Data represent USFWS-interest on the Sevilleta National Wildlife Refuge, New Mexico.
descript.purpose: To provide interested parties access to data which describe USFWS-interest on the Sevilleta National Wildlife Refuge (NWR)
descript.supplinf: "sev" is literal (identifier) for Sevilleta NWR; "int" signifies the interest acquired by USFWS

idinfo.useconst: General small scale (no greater than 1:24,000) mapping.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, Southwest Region

horizpa.horizpar: Data are derived from USFWS digital status maps of unknown horizontal accuracy.

procstep.procdesc: Digital files obtained from Realty Div. Cadastral Surveys and Mapping or undocumented source then fit to USGS 7.5 quadrangle maps.

enttyp.enttypd: Sevilleta NWR Land Ownership Status Boundary

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique six-character code assigned by the Washington Office, Division of Realty, to each organizational unit, area, or project site over which the Service has some type of jurisdiction.

Unique alpha codes assigned by the Washington Office, Division of Realty, that identify the organizational units, areas, and project sites on Service-owned lands, such as Baskett Slough National Wildlife Refuge (BSK), Faribault County Waterfowl Production Area (WFB), Livingston Stone National Fish Hatchery (LVN), etc. These codes are used as a means to cross-reference funding with individual land units.

Unique five-digit numeric codes assigned by the Washington Office, Division of Financial Management, to Service organizations where personnel are assigned and all unstaffed land management units. Organization codes may also be assigned to meet an administrative requirement.
Official name given to a Service organization that has been assigned an official five-digit numeric organization code by the Washington Office, Division of Financial Management.
The type of interest acquired by the US Fish and Wildlife Service
attr.attrdefs: Official Service land acquisition policy - http://policy.fws.gov/341fw1.html

edom.edomvd: full control (fee title) - ownership (may also include lands which were acquired by another federal agency which are managed by USFWS)
less-than-fee interest (partial control; easements, leases, or agreements)
inholding; private ownership; lands in which the US Fish and Wildlife Service has acquired no interest.
exclusion; lands which are excluded from US Fish and Wildlife Service acquisition.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, Southwest Region

distinfo.distliab: Although these data and information have been processed successfully on a computer system at the USFWS, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data and information on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data, and information, and aggregate use with other data and information. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data and information. The USFWS shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data and information described and/or contained herein.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, Southwest Region
